programmes.show_description: Shooter - Part One: DS Satchell and his family find themselves the target of a notorious crime gang when he witnesses the slaying of an informer following a jewellery raid.
Shooter - Part Two: Conclusion. With his wife and child missing, DS Satchell is desperate to resolve the situation as Walker and Connor find a pressure point in the Bilkin family.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
Grandfathers-in-Law: Classic British sitcom. When Lyn, David, and their baby Martin return from Canada, the arrival of their grandson seems to drive Simon and Oliver apart again.
Busmen's Perks: Enduring sitcom about a chirpy bus driver and his conductor pal. Stan's household is thrown into disarray when he decides to do a spot of home-decorating.
Gray meets Perdy and is shocked to see where she has been living. Jo and Andy are cleared by Environmental Health after the E-coli outbreak and Eli helps Belle with her business.
Katie is in turmoil when Gray mistakenly calls her Perdy after visiting his wife again. Laurel and Ashley lock horns over what to do about Arthur, and Matthew's car is vandalised.
A nervous Carla arms herself before confronting the intruder. Paul discovers Jack's winning betting slip but keeps quiet, while Violet and Jamie consider leaving Weatherfield.
Paul collects the winnings from Jack's bet and pays Dan to stay quiet. Jamie and Violet keep their move a secret from Sean, and Liam and Maria return from their honeymoon.
Appropriate Adults: Detective drama series. Billy Conrad has Down's syndrome and something to hide, but is he capable of murder? Frost intends to keep an open mind.
Take Three Girls: Carol and Dr Chris clash over the care of a pregnant teenager, and Peggy is pleased as punch when she thinks that David has caught a certain somebody's eye.
Hey! Hey! LBJ!: The police spring into action when a teenage girl disappears, and Peggy thinks that she and David have struck gold when he finds an old metal detector.
Blood Will Out: Barnaby and Troy are called in to investigate when a local magistrate and principal adversary of two groups of travellers is found dead at his home in Martyr Warren.
Hilary runs away with baby Arthur in an attempt to prevent the Dolands leaving, prompting Ashley to drop a bombshell. Zak worries about his job and Gray proposes to Katie.
Pollard wrongly assumes Val is his blackmailer. Mel and Greg are told they need a DNA test at the hospital and Jonny tells Chas and Diane about Katie and Gray's engagement.
As Jamie makes preparations for the secret move, Violet goes into labour and staggers into the pub for help, while Liam is bewildered when Carla asks Tony to move in with her.
Sean is at Violet's side as she gives birth to a healthy baby boy in the Rovers. Michelle tells Alex it's time he went home, and Paul finds himself playing by Dan's rules.
Danse Macabre: Joe and Carol join forces when their concerns for the welfare of a young ballerina grow, and David helps out at the local paper in an unexpected way.
Missing Persons: There is trouble in the village when a young couple leave their children home alone, and Gina's worries about her pregnancy are distracted by some unexpected news.
Not Dead Yet: Crime drama. A shocking attack on the Brighton music scene and a gruesome discovery on a Sussex pig farm force Grace to split his team to solve the two mysteries.
Pylon: The murder of a schoolgirl brings Endeavour back to Oxford. When he refuses to accept the main suspect's guilt, he has to uncover the truth before it's too late.
Appropriate Adults: Detective drama series. Billy Conrad has Down's syndrome and something to hide, but is he capable of murder? Frost intends to keep an open mind.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
Nursery Times: Classic British sitcom. When David and Lynn start looking for a home of their own, Simon deploys some emotional blackmail after Oliver wants them to stay with him.
Mum's Last Fling: Classic sitcom. Stan and Arthur are lost for words when Mum gets herself a new man and a mini-skirt.
Hilary runs away with baby Arthur in an attempt to prevent the Dolands leaving, prompting Ashley to drop a bombshell. Zak worries about his job and Gray proposes to Katie.
Pollard wrongly assumes Val is his blackmailer. Mel and Greg are told they need a DNA test at the hospital and Jonny tells Chas and Diane about Katie and Gray's engagement.
As Jamie makes preparations for the secret move, Violet goes into labour and staggers into the pub for help, while Liam is bewildered when Carla asks Tony to move in with her.
Sean is at Violet's side as she gives birth to a healthy baby boy in the Rovers. Michelle tells Alex it's time he went home, and Paul finds himself playing by Dan's rules.
Quarry: Crime drama. Frost delves into the world of animal rights when a young protester is fatally injured in a confrontation with stewards at a meeting of the Denton Lacey Hunt.
Danse Macabre: Joe and Carol join forces when their concerns for the welfare of a young ballerina grow, and David helps out at the local paper in an unexpected way.
Missing Persons: There is trouble in the village when a young couple leave their children home alone, and Gina's worries about her pregnancy are distracted by some unexpected news.
Death of a Stranger: Feature-length police drama. DI Barnaby realises that there is more to a case than first appears when the father of a man jailed for murder is himself killed.
Mel and Greg Doland attempt to flee the village with Arthur to avoid the consequences of the impending DNA test results.
An elated Sean drives Jamie and Violet to their wits' end as they try to care for the baby, and Michelle lets Alex stay a while longer - with disastrous consequences.
Lauren spills the beans to Sean about Jamie and Violet's plans to move away, while Michelle tries to convince a panic-stricken Alex to unlock the pub door.
Taking Stock: The police discover that a man killed in a car accident had a chequered past, and Oscar and a reluctant Alf join forces on a private detective case that goes awry.
The Big Chill: Joe and Rachel try to uncover a drug-smuggling ring, Peggy spots a gap in the market with Bernie's hearse out of action, and Gina makes an unwelcome new friend.
Home: Quiet life in suburbia takes a dark turn when a woman is found murdered in her garden, and DCI Vera Stanhope discovers that the neighbours aren't all that they seem...
Apollo: When a tragic car accident becomes something altogether more suspicious, Endeavour's investigations lead him to the Oxford astrophysics department and a TV puppet studio.
